text: The Wembley Central station is a railway (train) station in Wembley, London. It is a transfer station on the West Coast Main Line, London Overground and London Underground Backerloo Line. == History == * 20 July 1837: London and Birmingham Railway line opened * 1842: Station opened as "Sudbury" * 5 July 1948: renamed "Wembley Central" * February 2009: Southern services between Milton Keynes and East Croydon stop here (each hour Mon-Sat daytime). * December 2014: London Midland services between London Euston and Tring have been introduced (each hour Mon-Sat daytime). == References == == Other websites == Category:1840s establishments in England Category:1842 establishments Category:Bakerloo line stations Category:London Overground stations Category:Transport in the London Borough of Brent Category:Buildings and structures in the London Borough of Brent
title: Wembley Central station
